strapiPost.title: Postal Services code challenge #2 - Manage warehouses

data.content:
**In this series, we are building a number of services for a parcel company. Today we are building a prerequisite for sending parcels, the registering and managing of warehouses. If you have not followed the [setup of this challenge](https://jan-wagenaar.nl/blog/code-challenge-postal-services-1/), please do that first. Let's get started!**

#### User stories

**Description**

As an facility manager I would like to register and edit warehouses where packages will be distributed. These warehouses will be used later in planning shipment routes. Therefore its needed to enter the warehouse location. I would like to view the warehouse address on a map after entering its address, so I can review the location. Also, I would like to enter the warehouse capacity, in number of parcels.

The list of warehouses (and their attributes) is included in the starter pack under Resources / Data / Warehouses.xlsx

**Criteria**

-   Able to search and view warehouses
-   Able to save warehouse details
-   Able to enter package capacity

#### Resources that might help you

-   [Follow Building Web Forms training](https://learn.outsystems.com/training/journeys/building-web-forms-636)
-   [Learn how to implement a (free) map](https://www.outsystems.com/forge/component-documentation/6907/leafletjs-reactive/0)
-   [Role based governance in Outsystems](https://success.outsystems.com/documentation/11/developing_an_application/secure_the_application/user_roles/)

SEO.keywords: code challenge, micro services, learn, user stories, development, postal company, backend, senior developer, advanced challenge
SEO.metaDescription: In this series, we are building a number of services for a parcel company. Today we are building a form for registering and managing of warehouses.
